meanings.definition: A pin passed through the end of an axle to keep a wheel in position.
meanings.sent1: The linchpin held the wheel securely in place.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the linchpin regularly to prevent any accidents.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the linchpin was a shiny acorn.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the linchpin of the plan turned out to be a tiny detail.
meanings.sent5: Without the linchpin, the wheel wobbled dangerously.

meanings.definition: A person or thing vital to an organization or system.
meanings.sent1: She was the linchpin of the project, holding everything together.
meanings.sent2: The linchpin of the team's success was effective communication.
meanings.sent3: The linchpin teddy bear kept the office entertained during breaks.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to excellence made him the linchpin of the company.
meanings.sent5: The linchpin's absence caused chaos in the organization.
